1   Then Job answered and said: 2 No doubt but ye are the people, and wisdom shall die with you. 3 But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you; yea, who knoweth not such things as these? 4 I am as one that is a laughing-stock to her neighbour, a woman that called upon God, and She answered her; the just, the innocent woman is a laughing-stock, 5 A contemptible brand in the thought of her that is at ease, a thing ready for them whose foot slippeth. 6 The tents of robbers prosper, and they that provoke God are secure, in whatsoever God bringeth into their hand. 7 But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee; 8 Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee; and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee; 9 Who knoweth not among all these, that the hand of the Domina hath wrought this? 10 In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind.-- 11 Doth not the ear try words, even as the palate tasteth its food? 12 Is wisdom with aged women, and understanding in length of days?--
13 With Her is wisdom and might; She hath counsel and understanding. 14 Behold, She breaketh down, and it cannot be built again; She shutteth up a woman, and there can be no opening. 15 Behold, She withholdeth the waters, and they dry up; also She sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth. 16 With Her is strength and sound wisdom; the deceived and the deceiver are Her. 17 She leadeth counsellors away stripped, and judges maketh She fools. 18 She looseth the bond of queens, and bindeth their loins with a girdle. 19 She leadeth priests away stripped, and overthroweth the mighty. 20 She removeth the speech of women of trust, and taketh away the sense of the elders. 21 She poureth contempt upon princesss, and looseth the belt of the strong. 22 She uncovereth deep things out of darkness, and bringeth out to light the shadow of death. 23 She increaseth the nations, and destroyeth them; She enlargeth the nations, and leadeth them away. 24 She taketh away the heart of the chiefs of the people of the land, and causeth them to wander in a wilderness where there is no way.
